trans-unit.source: Draws a border, background, or both around another element.
Border can have only one child.
To display multiple child elements, you need to place an additional <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel> element within the parent Border.
You can then place child elements within that <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel> element.
If you want to display a border around your content, you must place the elements within a parent Border element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> class.
Arranges the contents of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> element.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border> can have only one child element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> this element uses to arrange its child element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the arranged size of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> element and its child element.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> that fills the area between the bounds of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> that draws the background.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border.Background*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> that draws the outer border color.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> that draws the outer border color.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border.BorderBrush*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the relative <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
The <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> that describes the width of the boundaries of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border.BorderThickness*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that represents the degree to which the corners of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> are rounded.
Although the property name suggests that you can use only singular values, CornerRadius also supports non-uniform radii.
Radius values that are too large are scaled so that they blend smoothly from corner to corner.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
The <xref href="System.Windows.CornerRadius"></xref> that describes the degree to which corners are rounded.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border.CornerRadius*> dependency property.
To be added.
Measures the child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> before they are arranged during the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border.ArrangeOverride*> pass.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border> element determines its upper <xref:System.Windows.Size> limit by analyzing the sizing properties, margin, and requested size of its child elements.
An upper <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> limit that cannot be exceeded.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that represents the upper size limit of the element.
Draws the contents of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> object during the render pass of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> that defines the object to be drawn.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> value that describes the amount of space between a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> and its child element.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
The <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> that describes the amount of space between a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Border"></xref> and its single child element.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Border.Padding*> dependency property.
To be added.
